forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 47. South southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. North wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
In the stillness of early morning, Downtown San Francisco awakens under a mostly clear sky, the cool air carrying whispers of calm. The temperature hovers around a gentle 47 degrees, and a light breeze from the south-southwest (just enough to tease the edges of a light jacket) creates an atmosphere that invites reflection and quiet observation. As the sun prepares to cradle this vibrant city, expect a welcoming warmth to rise, though it will only touch the midday heights of about 65 before gracefully receding to a comfortable 63 by afternoon. The air remains clear, a rare blessing, allowing the distant Golden Gate Bridge to stand in striking clarity, almost ethereal against the backdrop of blue.

Today feels like an opportunity to engage in the understated joys of the city. A stroll along the Embarcadero would offer a refreshing perspective, with the bay glistening under the sun’s ascent, or perhaps a leisurely visit to one of the many cafes tucked within the charming corners of Noe Valley or the Mission. Layering is key for those taking on the day; a light jacket or a soft sweater will serve well for the morning chill, while a simple tee might suffice as the sun brings its warmth. With the absence of fog, the typical marine layer will have retreated, gifting residents and visitors alike with a remarkable vista of this storied metropolis. So, head out, savor the day, and let the crisp air invigorate you.
